intro: Moraea porrifolia, commonly known as the onion lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered bulbs underground. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea porrifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
